edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature

Class OpenSSLDSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature.OpenSSLDSA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DigitalSignature, DSABasedSignature, MacSignSecLevel, OneTime, SecurityLevel, UnlimitedTimes

    public class OpenSSLDSA
extends java.lang.Object
implements DSABasedSignature
    This class implements the DSA signature scheme using OpenSSL library.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Sets this DSA with a public key.

        In this case the signature object can be used only for verification.

        Specified by:
        setKey in interface DigitalSignature
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be an instance of DSAPublicKey.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is not an instance of DSAPublicKey.

        Description copied from interface: DigitalSignature

      • getPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
        Returns the PublicKey of this DSA signature scheme. This function should not be use to check if the key has been set. To check if the key has been set use isKeySet function.
        Specified by:
        getPublicKey in interface DigitalSignature
        Returns:
        the DSAPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

      • sign

        public Signature sign(byte[] msg,
             int offset,
             int length)
               throws java.security.KeyException
        Signs the given message.
        Specified by:
        sign in interface DigitalSignature
        Parameters:
        msg - the byte array to sign.
        offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from.
        length - the length of the msg.
        Returns:
        the signature from the msg signing.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyException - if PrivateKey is not set.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(Signature signature,
             byte[] msg,
             int offset,
             int length)
        Verifies the given signatures.
        Specified by:
        verify in interface DigitalSignature
        Parameters:
        signature - to verify. Should be an instance of OpenSSLDSASignature.
        msg - the byte array to verify the signature with
        offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from
        length - the length of the msg
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid. false, otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Signature does not match this signature scheme.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.

      • generateKey

        public java.security.KeyPair generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                  throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
        This function is not supported in this class. Use generateKey() instead.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface DigitalSignature
        Parameters:
        keyParams - hold the required key parameters
        Returns:
        KeyPair holding the public and private keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if the given keyParams does not match this signature scheme.
